triples.name: Rust (programming language)
triples.relevance: Verus is specifically designed to verify Rust programs, leveraging Rust's type system and linear types.

triples.name: Type system
triples.relevance: Verus relies on Rust's type system that checks linearity and borrowing to enable safe memory manipulation.

triples.name: Substructural type system
triples.relevance: Linear types are a form of substructural types, which Verus uses to track resource permissions and ownership.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Verus is an SMT-based tool for formally verifying Rust programs beyond type safety.

triples.name: Satisfiability modulo theories
triples.relevance: Verus uses SMT solvers to discharge proof obligations and verify specifications automatically.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Memory safety is a core goal that Verus supports through linear types and proof of correct memory manipulation.

triples.name: Concurrent computing
triples.relevance: Verus is demonstrated on concurrent code, verifying properties of concurrent resource access.

triples.name: Pointer (computer programming)
triples.relevance: Verus proves correctness of pointer-manipulating code like the xor-based doubly linked list example.

triples.name: Typed lambda calculus
triples.relevance: Verus formalizes its linearity and borrowing semantics using a small lambda calculus with linear types.
